availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organization of higher education in Lexington, Kentucky. Established by an act of the assembly of the Commonwealth of Virginia as Transylvania Seminary in 1780. First classes were held in Danville in 1785. Campus moved to Lexington, Kentucky, in 1793. Transylvania University - including a law school and medical school - is established by the legislature of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1799. Transylvania University merges with Kentucky University and loses its name from 1865 to 1908. Kentucky University reclaims the name of Transylvania University in 1908.

ab.bibl: "Our History," Transylvania University, http://www.transy.edu/about/our-history, (c) 2003-2016 by Transylvania University\ (accessed January 2, 2020).
